channel.title: Visual basic O.S GUI (pics added)
channel.description:
basically i originally invented it as a safeguard for my computer, but as i went along i decided i can do alot with this gui so now i call it publicComputer. Here's the development so far. [hr /] Works Still working on it Haven't started [hr /] Working Media Player Working Taskbar Taskmanager Gui Internet Detection/Explorer Hotkey Block Desktop Seperate Folder(kde like, with background and icons seperate) Working User Panel < needs a bit improved in v2 Desktop Manager working log-on gui
Here is an unofficial picture of what the layout looks like. [img]http://sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash2/hs050.ash2/35841_1348467355640_1350004148_30836510_794379_n.jpg[/img] what you will see in this image is the beggining of the desktop icons area, you can fullscreen it ect... but i want it to move around and have a better look :P so i'm working on it [img]http://sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash2/hs050.ash2/35841_1348467435642_1350004148_30836512_1522878_n.jpg[/img]
Pictures still uploading i'll have them by tommorow, but right now what i want to know is what else should i add?

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:18, topic:347523"][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=443902.msg3261036#msg3261036 date=1278489303]

[quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=443902.msg3260979#msg3260979 date=1278481674]

BRB USING POINT AND CLICK LANGUAGE TO DEVELOP SOME RANDOM SHIT THAT SHOULD EMULATE AN OS.
[/quote]Being close-minded won’t get you anywhere.

Neither will using a shit programming language, kthxbai.
[/quote][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=443902.msg3259541#msg3259541 date=1278389790]
BRB USING POINT AND CLICK LANGUAGE TO DEVELOP SOME RANDOM SHIT THAT SHOULD EMULATE AN OS program.
[/quote]HAHA! I tell this to Lin all the time.

fuck off c# isn’t point and click the gui designer is.[/quote]
IMO, Visual Studio VB, and Visual Studio C# are about the same in the programs themselves. Except the stronger language is C#. To the point though, is it actually worth it, wasting away your life over a programming language someone is using?

basically i originally invented it as a safeguard for my computer, but as i went along i decided i can do alot with this gui so now i call it publicComputer. Here’s the development so far.
[hr /]
Works
Still working on it
Haven’t started
[hr /]
Working Media Player
Working Taskbar
Taskmanager Gui
Internet Detection/Explorer
Hotkey Block
Desktop Seperate Folder(kde like, with background and icons seperate)
Working User Panel < needs a bit improved in v2
Desktop Manager
working log-on gui

Here is an unofficial picture of what the layout looks like.

what you will see in this image is the beggining of the desktop icons area, you can fullscreen it ect… but i want it to move around and have a better look so i’m working on it
